data.title: Restored Courthouse
data.text: Brought back from the dead courthouse. Amazing restoration.  Good local historical information.  Knowledgeable volunteers.

data.title: Great historical renovation
data.text: This is one of the most beautiful museums in the area!  The architecture is lovely.  Exhibits are changing and there are wonderful things to see about culture and history.  It's easily accessed as it is in the Downtown West Palm Beach area.

data.title: Very Neat and Informative for a Local Museum
data.text: Great organization and research. Enjoyed my visit greatly. They have done a great job with the resources they have.

data.title: Get a taste of Palm Beach Before it was Discovered
data.text: It is great to see a building repurposed rather than torn down. The Old Palm Beach Court House is now a museum with a current excellent exhibit about the role of Florida in the Civil War. Be sure to visit the fourth floor to see the old court room as well as an exhibit about the Florida constitution. Also get a chance to view the infamous 2000 ballot that forced the Presidential election to end up in the lap of the US Supreme Court. This museum is free and open to the public. The new, more modern court house is across the street

data.title: Good place for local history
data.text: We bring our friends here to give them an idea of the local history of the area. The displays are ever changing and on average we come here once a year. Parking can be an issue since the parking is metered except Sunday. Expect to pay $0.25 per 12 minutes and on average it will take somewhere between 1 to 1.5 hrs to give it justice when visiting.

data.title: Architectural treasure historical displays
data.text: Historic  Court  House has been revealed downtown and houses displays of local history.  Low cost on street and lot parking.  In-season speaker events are available at moderate to low cost for non members, free for members.  Just north of downtown Clematis area.

data.title: Unexpected Find
data.text: I entered the old courthouse building expecting to see an architectural gem from the past, it's empty courtrooms and nothing more.  But what I did find, was a treasure trove of historical artifacts, excellent displays and a beautifully restored building.  At the time, I saw a comprehensive exhibit of Palm Beach's fire  department s equipment, uniforms throughout the years.  There were also displays on various historically significant Palm Beach personalities, from education, society, the media, etc.  Lots of fun artifacts from bygone eras...  And, there were other displays in the courtroom on those who served as judges, etc.  well worth a visit.  I was even lucky to hear about how this beautiful building was saved from "modernization"!

data.title: Wonderful historical museum
data.text: Located in the old courthouse, start your visit with the entrance hall where you learn the history of the building.  In the 70's this beautiful edifice was "wrapped" in an update that turned it into something more utilitarian for for the courts.  Basically, they ruined it!  Then you can see the pictures that show how they undid the atrocity, revealing the historic building that was then restored.  If that isn't enough, the there are historic exhibits that are fascinating.  Be sure to go to the second floor to see an actual restored court room!

data.title: Restored Historic Property
data.text: The first floor contains the majority of exhibits. A portion of the second floor and third floor house the historic courtroom, which contains a handful of exhibits.

data.title: Palm Beach History!
data.text: Great free museum. Entertaining for an hour or two. Learn the history of Palm Beach county and for whom the landmarks all around the county are named.

data.title: family fun
data.text: old courthouse museum shows alittle history ,u can see what an old courthouse looked like for trials. they also talk about somne nature things in the developement of palm beach county and it is free by donation u can spend altealst 1 and half to 2 hours there the ladies are friendly and will give u a tour or answer questions u may have they have a small gift hsop and out side in the other building behind is a small cafe to grab some lunch

data.title: Surprisingly good!
data.text: Went there on a rainy day with zero expectations. For a small, free (donations appreciated) museum we found it informative, enjoyable and educational. Having lived here for over 20 years I learned a lot. I think children will enjoy it also. Take the time to appreciate the architecture of this original gem!

data.title: Plan lots of time because there's so much to see!
data.text: I've lived here 30 years and learned so much about the history of Palm Beach County! The way it's split between People and Places. Very interactive and engaging for adults and children. Going upstairs to see the original courtroom was breathtaking. A special exhibit "Courage Under Fire" 120 years of fire rescue in Palm Beach County runs through 6/27/15 and was awesome from pictures to equipment, videos, etc. The pictures and story of the restoration of this 1916 courthouse is amazing!

data.title: Richard and Pat Johnson Museum
data.text: The museum is wonderful for Palm Beach, it's the type of museum you can experience in a few hours. The museum has nice facilities, good staff. Prices are low. The hours are very  good. I enjoyed several exhibits.

data.title: Very interesting introduction to palm beach county history
data.text:
If you are a resident or snowbird and want to know more about the history of the palm beaches, this place is for you.  Docents Linda and Judy provided an introduction to the major sections of the displays and answered additional questions as well.

They usually have special temporary exhibits too, so check out their web page for details.

data.title: Local History Museum in Restored 1916 Courthouse
data.text:
This is my second visit to the museum over the last several years.  During this visit I didn't have time to visit the permanent collection on West Palm Beach history (which I recommend seeing).  My goal was to see the touring exhibit "The Courage to Remember, the Holocaust 1933-1945."  I was also able to see an excellent temporary exhibit called "Courage Under Fire, 120 years of Fire Rescue" which was a history of the West Palm Beach Fire Department.  It was only one room but was well done and worth seeing.  It will be on display until June 27, 2015.  The museum is located a short walk from the waterfront and is worth a short visit.

There is no admission fee but a donation of $5.00 is recommended.  There are guided tours which I did not take advantage of this visit.

The old courthouse is located directly across from the new courthouse and the contrast is quite interesting.

data.title: Wonderful downtown WPB museum and beautiful example of historic preservation
data.text: Just moved to downtown WPB and decided to visit this museum since I am always wanting to know the history of where I live at. I was also interested in seeing the inside of the museum because it is located at the old county courthouse that was beautifully restored. We were met by a wonderful volunteer named Shirley who briefly gave a history on the county courthouse and how it was restored with most salvageable materials that could be saved and restored. Shirley also gave a brief tour on a new exhibit on the firefighting history of the city of WPB (Fact: The Breakers Hotel burned to the ground twice because it was built by wood). The other exhibits were also very educational (Bet your friend that WPB was the first incorporated city in Dade County and you would win because Palm Beach County was carved from Dade County). The museum has a wealth of information that any resident or visitor should explore. The added bonus is that admission is free and there is a wonderful gift shop with a great selection of books and gifts.

data.title: Excellent Overview of Museum and Downtown Area
data.text:
Our docent Rick is a local architect and brought the history of the old 1916 court house alive.  The bldg. was almost torn down but luckily, thanks to the Historical Society and other concerned folks, it was saved and is back to its almost original, glorious self.  The 1.5 hr. walk included Clematis Street, and Rick's knowledge opened our eyes.

The tour is usually given the first Friday of every month from approx. Jan through April at 4:00 p.m.  We parked at Kravis and took the trolley over to Dixie Hwy and then a short walk to the court house.  Arrived at the museum in time to spend about 1 hr. going thru the various exhibits which include a history of settling Palm Beach and presently about the Indians (People of the Water).

data.title: History of Palm Beach
data.text: 6 ladies all enjoyed our 1 1/2 hr tour, with docent Sue, who was excellent.  If you are a history buff or just are curious about  this area, this gem of a museum is a great choice.

data.title: Interesante!
data.text: Si te gustan los museos no dejes de visitar este! la mayor parte de la exposicion la encontras en el primer piso y el resto en el segundo y tercer nivel. Divino!
